Package ca.utoronto.utm.assignment2.paint.shapes

Class Polyline

java.lang.Object
ca.utoronto.utm.assignment2.paint.shapes.Shape
ca.utoronto.utm.assignment2.paint.shapes.Squiggle
ca.utoronto.utm.assignment2.paint.shapes.Polyline
public class Polyline extends Squiggle
The Polyline class represents a polyline shape, which is a series of connected points that form a continuous line. This class extends the Squiggle class and adds functionality to track whether the polyline has started or not.

A polyline is often used to draw a series of straight lines between multiple points.

    • Polyline

      public Polyline(Point point, PaintProperties pp, ArrayList<Point> path)
      Constructs a Polyline object with the given starting point, paint properties, and a list of points representing the path of the polyline.
      Parameters:
      point - The starting point of the polyline.
      pp - The paint properties associated with the polyline.
      path - An ArrayList of points representing the path of the polyline.

  • Method Details

    • hasStarted

      public boolean hasStarted()
      Checks if the polyline has started drawing.
      Returns:
      true if the polyline has started, false otherwise.

    • setStarted

      public void setStarted(boolean started)
      Sets the state of whether the polyline has started drawing.
      Parameters:
      started - The state to set. If true, the polyline is considered to have started.
